util.runtime.jvm

Class JvmCmdFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.runtime.jvm.JvmCmdFactory

  • public class JvmCmdFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory methods to build a command to launch a JVM.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JvmCmdFactory() 

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static JvmCmdBuilder java(ClassPathJvmArg classPath, ProgramArgument<java.lang.String> mainClass)
      Builds a command to launch a JVM with a main class.
      static JvmCmdBuilder java(JarJvmArg appToRun)
      Builds a command to launch a JVM with a jar file.
      static JvmCmdBuilder java(ProgramArgument<java.nio.file.Path> jvmPath, ClassPathJvmArg classPath, ProgramArgument<java.lang.String> mainClass)
      Builds a command to launch a JVM with a main class.
      static JvmCmdBuilder java(ProgramArgument<java.nio.file.Path> jvmPath, JarJvmArg appToRun)
      Builds a command to launch a JVM with a jar file.
      static ProgramArgument<java.nio.file.Path> jvm()
      Builds a an argument with the absolute path of executable of the currently running JVM if that could be determined; otherwise falls back to the JVM in the system path.
      static ProgramArgument<java.nio.file.Path> thisJvm()
      Attempts to build a an argument with the absolute path of executable of the currently running JVM.

    • Method Detail

      • java

        public static JvmCmdBuilder java(ProgramArgument<java.nio.file.Path> jvmPath,
                                 ClassPathJvmArg classPath,
                                 ProgramArgument<java.lang.String> mainClass)
        Builds a command to launch a JVM with a main class.
        Parameters:
        jvmPath - the path to the JVM executable.
        classPath - the class path to pass to the JVM.
        mainClass - the main class to run.
        Returns:
        a command builder that can be further customized (e.g. setting system properties or specifying main method arguments) before getting the tokens that make up the command line.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null.

      • java

        public static JvmCmdBuilder java(ClassPathJvmArg classPath,
                                 ProgramArgument<java.lang.String> mainClass)
        Builds a command to launch a JVM with a main class. The JVM in question will be either another instance of the this running JVM if its absolute path can be determined, or the JVM in the system path, if any.
        Parameters:
        classPath - the class path to pass to the JVM.
        mainClass - the main class to run.
        Returns:
        a command builder that can be further customized (e.g. setting system properties or specifying main method arguments) before getting the tokens that make up the command line.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null.

      • java

        public static JvmCmdBuilder java(ProgramArgument<java.nio.file.Path> jvmPath,
                                 JarJvmArg appToRun)
        Builds a command to launch a JVM with a jar file.
        Parameters:
        jvmPath - the path to the JVM executable.
        appToRun - the jar file containing the application to run.
        Returns:
        a command builder that can be further customized (e.g. setting system properties or specifying main method arguments) before getting the tokens that make up the command line.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null.

      • java

        public static JvmCmdBuilder java(JarJvmArg appToRun)
        Builds a command to launch a JVM with a jar file. The JVM in question will be either another instance of the this running JVM if its absolute path can be determined, or the JVM in the system path, if any.
        Parameters:
        appToRun - the jar file containing the application to run.
        Returns:
        a command builder that can be further customized (e.g. setting system properties or specifying main method arguments) before getting the tokens that make up the command line.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null.

      • jvm

        public static ProgramArgument<java.nio.file.Path> jvm()
        Builds a an argument with the absolute path of executable of the currently running JVM if that could be determined; otherwise falls back to the JVM in the system path.
        Returns:
        the JVM path.

      • thisJvm

        public static ProgramArgument<java.nio.file.Path> thisJvm()
        Attempts to build a an argument with the absolute path of executable of the currently running JVM.
        Returns:
        this JVM's path.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the path could not be determined.
